text: hello, HubSpot provide the built in softphone or not?

Hey everyone,

Just following up on my previous post regarding the issue with tracking Google and Facebook leads after the recent API shift. We haven't received any feedback yet and would really appreciate your insights or suggestions on how to resolve this. Has anyone else faced similar issues or found a workaround?

Also, is there a *Discord* community for HubSpot? If so, please let us know.

Thanks in advance for your help!
Hi <@U05JX5QBNN8> yes you can do that we can connect if you want help on this and will show you show how to do that even

Hello,
We would like to use HubSpot to collect our contacts and use them later on Google for offline conversion.
We're not thinking of using HubSpot LPs, but rather forms on our websites.
We've seen that HubSpot offers a solution with codes to collect contacts from external forms, but it seems very complex for our solution because it conflicts with javascript: <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/fr/forms/use-non-HubSpot-forms>

Does HubSpot have an API solution for harvesting contacts from our external forms? It would be a great help and we could capitalize on HubSpot. I can't find any process or solution online please.

Thanks for your help

heyya hoping to find some guidance here :innocent:

we've been using the custom events API and there are some event completions that are duplicated for some contacts and we would like to delete those - i've looked over the documentation and the current 'DELETE' methods that exist seem to be directly at the custom event level and not at the event completion level, and after looking through the documentation it seems we can't modify / delete completed events,  if someone has faced this and found a workaround  some pointers would be really appreciated here :heart_hands::skin-tone-2:

Hi All!
Quick question, is private APP webhook available in Free and starter packages or not ? Couldn't find any upfront documentation about this :D

I'm using custom code in a workflow to get subscription statuses from the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/marketing-api/subscriptions-preferences|subscription preferences endpoint>. The code is supposed to check and see if any of the subscription statuses have been updated via the subscription preferences page (which shows up like this in a test call)
```"sourceOfStatus": "SUBSCRIPTION_STATUS",
"brandId": null,
"preferenceGroupName": null,
"legalBasis": "CONSENT_WITH_NOTICE",
"legalBasisExplanation": "Manage Preferences"```
This is the loop that's checking it but it keeps returning false even on my test contact that I pasted the result from above. My python coding isn't great, so after a few rounds of asking ChatGPT for help, I'm here.
``` Define the text to match 
    MATCHING_TEXT = "Manage Preferences"
    
    # Define the endpoint URL
    check_subscription_endpoint_url = f"<https://api.hubapi.com/communication-preferences/v3/status/email/{email}>"

try:
        # Make the GET request to the endpoint
        response = requests.get(check_subscription_endpoint_url, headers=headers)
        
        # Check if the request was successful
        if response.status_code == 200:
            # Parse the JSON response
            data = response.json()
            # Initialize the legalBasisExplanation as an empty string
            legalBasisExplanation = ""
            
            # Check each item in the subscriptionStatuses list
            for item in data.get("subscriptionStatuses", []):
                # Check if the 'legalBasisExplanation' key exists and is not None or undefined
                if 'legalBasisExplanation' in item and item['legalBasisExplanation'].lower() == MATCHING_TEXT.lower():
                    legalBasisExplanation = "True"
                    break  # Exit the loop early since we found a match
        else:
            # Handle the error if the request was not successful
            data = {"error": f"Failed to fetch data, status code: {response.status_code}", "details": response.text}
            legalBasisExplanation = "False"
    
    except requests.exceptions.RequestException as e:
        # Print the error message
        print(f"An error occurred: {e}")
        data = {"error": "Request failed", "details": str(e)}```

It seems like the `upsert` endpoints are missing from all of the CRM object types in the Ruby client library; there's been a bug open in GitHub about this for ~3 months. Any chance of getting these regenerated to actually include this method?

<https://github.com/HubSpot/HubSpot-api-ruby/issues/325>
